creator: kaushal_j@hotmail.com
text:
<!--#ELSE SSI in mod_include.c truncatesif the text within the ELSE is long

In plain SSI on the 2.0 series if the text within the else block is big then 
the apache truncates the text and also confuses between the IF and ELSE(i.ie it 
executes both blocks of the IF and as well as the ELSE block) i checked this 
bug to be present in the 2.0.47 and also 2.0.48.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
mod_include in 2.0 has some known problems. There was a rewrite of the main
parser in 2.1 but wasn't backported yet to 2.0. You may want to try out the
patch provided in Bug 22946.

thanks Andre,
                 I tried but was not able to get the patch code for the bug id 
22946, where would I be able to pick that patch from?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Please test Andre's patch and comment if you care to see his new efforts
  backported to a coming 2.0.x release.  We need tests from both the project
  and from our wider community.  See Andre's URL above.

  I think this is actually a regression - I'm noticing newly broken behavior
  in the httpd-test/perl-framework/ suite - but then again - it could simply
  be new tests introduced to debug exactly this problem.
